CloudProvider.description: Human-readable label that identifies the cloud provider that stores this snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "replicaSet".`

CreatedAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud took the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

Description.description: Human-readable phrase or sentence that explains the purpose of the snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"status": "onDemand"`.

ExpiresAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud deletes the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

FrequencyType.description: Human-readable label that identifies how often this snapshot triggers.

Id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the snapshot.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

MasterKeyUUID.description: Unique string that identifies the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Master Key (CMK) used to encrypt the snapshot. The resource returns this value when `"encryptionEnabled" : true`.

MongodVersion.description: Version of the MongoDB host that this snapshot backs up.

PolicyItems.description: List that contains unique identifiers for the policy items.

ReplicaSetName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the replica set from which MongoDB Cloud took this snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "replicaSet"`

SnapshotType.description: Human-readable label that identifies when this snapshot triggers.

Status.description: Human-readable label that indicates the stage of the backup process for this snapshot.

StorageSizeBytes.description: Number of bytes taken to store the backup snapshot.

Type.description: Human-readable label that categorizes the cluster as a replica set or sharded cluster.

CloudProvider.description: Human-readable label that identifies the cloud provider that stores this snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "replicaSet".`

Id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the snapshot.

ReplicaSetName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the shard or config host from which MongoDB Cloud took this snapshot.

CreatedAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud took the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

Description.description: Human-readable phrase or sentence that explains the purpose of the snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"status": "onDemand"`.

ExpiresAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud deletes the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

FrequencyType.description: Human-readable label that identifies how often this snapshot triggers.

Id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the snapshot.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

MasterKeyUUID.description: Unique string that identifies the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Master Key (CMK) used to encrypt the snapshot. The resource returns this value when `"encryptionEnabled" : true`.

Members.description: List that includes the snapshots and the cloud provider that stores the snapshots. The resource returns this parameter when `"type" : "SHARDED_CLUSTER"`.

MongodVersion.description: Version of the MongoDB host that this snapshot backs up.

PolicyItems.description: List that contains unique identifiers for the policy items.

SnapshotIds.description: List that contains the unique identifiers of the snapshots created for the shards and config host for a sharded cluster. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "SHARDED_CLUSTER"`. These identifiers should match the ones specified in the **members[n].id** parameters. This allows you to map a snapshot to its shard or config host name.

SnapshotType.description: Human-readable label that identifies when this snapshot triggers.

Status.description: Human-readable label that indicates the stage of the backup process for this snapshot.

StorageSizeBytes.description: Number of bytes taken to store the backup snapshot.

Type.description: Human-readable label that categorizes the cluster as a replica set or sharded cluster.

Href.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that points another API resource to which this response has some relationship. This URL often begins with `https://mms.mongodb.com`.

Rel.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that defines the semantic relationship between this resource and another API resource. This URL often begins with `https://mms.mongodb.com`.

description: Returns, takes, and removes Cloud Backup snapshots.

CloudProvider.description: Human-readable label that identifies the cloud provider that stores this snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "replicaSet".`

ClusterName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the cluster.

CreatedAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud took the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

Description.description: Human-readable phrase or sentence that explains the purpose of the snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"status": "onDemand"`.

ExpiresAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud deletes the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

FrequencyType.description: Human-readable label that identifies how often this snapshot triggers.

GroupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your project.

Id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the snapshot.

IncludeCount.description: Flag that indicates whether the response returns the total number of items (**totalCount**) in the response.

ItemsPerPage.description: Number of items that the response returns per page.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

MasterKeyUUID.description: Unique string that identifies the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Master Key (CMK) used to encrypt the snapshot. The resource returns this value when `"encryptionEnabled" : true`.

Members.description: List that includes the snapshots and the cloud provider that stores the snapshots. The resource returns this parameter when `"type" : "SHARDED_CLUSTER"`.

MongodVersion.description: Version of the MongoDB host that this snapshot backs up.

PageNum.description: Number of the page that displays the current set of the total objects that the response returns.

PolicyItems.description: List that contains unique identifiers for the policy items.

ReplicaSetName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the replica set from which MongoDB Cloud took this snapshot. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "replicaSet"`

Results.description: List of returned documents that MongoDB Cloud provides when completing this request.

RetentionInDays.description: Number of days that MongoDB Cloud should retain the on-demand snapshot. Must be at least **1**

SnapshotId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the desired snapshot.

SnapshotIds.description: List that contains the unique identifiers of the snapshots created for the shards and config host for a sharded cluster. The resource returns this parameter when `"type": "SHARDED_CLUSTER"`. These identifiers should match the ones specified in the **members[n].id** parameters. This allows you to map a snapshot to its shard or config host name.

SnapshotType.description: Human-readable label that identifies when this snapshot triggers.

Status.description: Human-readable label that indicates the stage of the backup process for this snapshot.

StorageSizeBytes.description: Number of bytes taken to store the backup snapshot.

TotalCount.description: Number of documents returned in this response.

Type.description: Human-readable label that categorizes the cluster as a replica set or sharded cluster.
